intro: Linosyris compressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Linosyris compressa produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
